course.subject: ELEC
course.name: CMOS VLSI Design
course.description: CMOS process and design rules; MOS device electronics; CMOS circuit and logic circuit characterization and performance estimation; VLSI design and verification tools. Laboratory work will be centered on industry standard tools.
course.prerequisites: ELEC 2200 OR ELEC 3310 OR ISDN 4000D

reviews.author: tisb1234
reviews.comment_content:
The introductory level of CMOS devices.
Starting from principal concept of CMOS technology to fabrication of these devices.

There is only one lecture per week (2 hours) and 6 labs in total (the labs are not mandatory to attend, so you can skip them). Plus since there is only one lecture per week, there is not much to study for midterm and final. Plus it is easy to catch up.

The course contents are quite interesting if you are willing to learn this technology.

Plus it is very easy. Just listen to what the professor says.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor teaches very well. Very concise as well. Most importantly it is clear that he wants us to learn more and understand better.

He also posts video lectures on canvas so you can refer to that.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading. The midterm is really easy if you go to the lectures regularly and read the lecture notes. Professor just tests on simple concepts for the midterm.
Mean: 75 and SD: 16

For final, it is more difficult than the midterm but still manageable. You just need to understand the lecture notes. The mean is lower than expected.
Mean: 55 and SD: 19

Group project marks are not shown.
reviews.comment_workload:
There is only one lecture per week (2 hours, no attendance) and no homework/tutorial. There is one group project.
There are 6 labs in total but not mandatory to attend. These labs are to help group project.

Overall, basically very low workload. You only need to spend some time while doing the group project.

reviews.author: garbage
reviews.title: I love this course.
reviews.comment_content:
CMOS process and design rules; MOS device electronics; CMOS circuit and logic circuit characterization and performance estimation; VLSI design and verification tools. Laboratory work will be centered on industry standard tools.
Take this if you are going for the semiconductor industry. Seriously.
reviews.comment_teaching: I personally think the teaching is super nice. Although this is the first time the instructor teaches this course.
reviews.comment_grading: Would update the grading when the result comes out.
reviews.comment_workload: Drawing the layout could be a bit time consuming, but you would surely learn a lot from it. The exams are not that difficult.

reviews.author: Jack Zhang
reviews.title: Useless and non-sense lectures
reviews.comment_content:
A little about CMOS behavior at the beginning, all covered in the ELEC3400. Mostly about CMOS design and manufactures. Rules and tips are the most important.
6 labs, the most important part of this course. learning cadence and build CMOS blocks.
reviews.comment_teaching: terrible. professor talking about irrelevant staff in class and complaining about non-sense. Spend too much time on not important slides and waste a lot of time. cannot finish all his slides. reading ppt like textbook in the class (why do i need you professor?) cannot explain question from me with good reasoning.
reviews.comment_grading:
50% assignment, 3 assignments in total.
50% project with clear grading scheme but no one know the scores.
Personally, i got nearly full mark in HW1 and HW2, don't know about HW3 and project (should be above mean), and final grade B. (it's like sh*t)
Update: After I emailed Prof. they updated HW3 but didn't update project. I got 59 in HW3, and mean is around 77 for all three assignments. My project got 78, but don't know about others.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 assignments, 2 days for each at most. project take our group 5 days (4 people in a group) don't know why there is no midterm and final but there are previously. The project is to design a carry-skip 16 bit adder, it is quite interesting, but not interesting with shitty grade. Generally, not heavy workload, but I still give it E for the god damn sake.
